title: Recommendations anyone?
content:
I’m looking for a strong masthead typeface for an outdoor activities magazine with an eco slant. It should be something that isn’t overly masculine - no heavy sans faces - and distressed faces are out too.

It’s not a newstand title as such so there isn’t that need to punch out from the shelf and perhaps this allows me leeway to pick something with a little more personality.

Have looked at what seems like a million typefaces and so far I’m stumped so any suggestions would be gladly received!

 [‹ Why is it so common for typefaces to include small caps in only one weight, such as regular/medium?](http://web.archive.org/web/20071215122847/http:/www.typophile.com/node/39913 "Go to previous forum topic") [help needed- which typeface would pair well with Clarendon? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071215122847/http:/www.typophile.com/node/39855 "Go to next forum topic")
author: mattmcarthur

comments.content:
here’s my thought process

eco = organic = lettering = diy or find a good [lettering artist](http://web.archive.org/web/20071215122847/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/lettering%252Bartists)

there are several good lettering artists, and [Mark Simonson](http://web.archive.org/web/20071215122847/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Mark%252BSimonson) listed quite a few in a recent thread. Mark himself is an excellent letterer. i’ll see if i can’t find that thread...
aha, here it is if you’re interested: [Drawing Letters](http://web.archive.org/web/20071215122847/http:/www.typophile.com/node/38408)
Thanks for the pointer - will take a look at that.
